column4: hey btw my school's considering a switch to Linux, do you think they should consult proffesionals like RedHat or Novell or just follow the free distros ?
hardy isn't released yet, but it would more than likely be a good choice when it is

yes i was thinking that way cuz afterall it's much like RHEL or SLED ( ok even WAY better then SLED ), and they could always buy support from canonical in case they need really professional high-end stuff
